intro: Machaerina ayangannensis, commonly known as the Ayangannensis Machaerina, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and purple. The plant has woody stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
